detaileddescription.para: id of the channel the message was sent in
Optional: id of the guild the message was sent in
the author of this message (not guaranteed to be a valid user)
Optional: member properties for this message's author
contents of the message
message components
when this message was sent
when this message was edited (may be 0 if never edited)
users specifically mentioned in the message
roles specifically mentioned in this message (only IDs currently)

Channels mentioned in the message. (Discord: not all types supported) Discord: Only textual channels that are visible to everyone in a lurkable guild will ever be included. Only crossposted messages (via Channel Following) currently include mention_channels at all. (includes ID, Guild ID, Type, Name)
any attached files
Up to 10 dpp::embed objects
Optional: reactions to the message
Optional: used for validating a message was sent
Optional: if the message is generated by a webhook, its id will be here otherwise the field will be 0
Stickers
Name of file to upload (for use server-side in discord's url)
File content to upload (raw binary)
Mime type of files to upload

briefdescription.para: The cluster which created this message object.

Flags. Made of bits in dpp::message_flags
whether this message is pinned
whether this was a TTS message
whether this message mentions everyone

briefdescription.para: Unique ID of object set by Discord. This value contains a timestamp, worker ID, internal server ID, and an incrementing value. Only the timestamp is relevant to us as useful metadata.

briefdescription.para: Construct a new message object.
Construct a new message object.

parameterdescription.para: Owning cluster, passed down to various things such as dpp::attachment. Owning cluster is optional (can be nullptr) and if nulled, will prevent some functions such as attachment::download from functioning (they will throw, if used)

briefdescription.para: Destroy the message object.
